pageContext.description: The upper plate of one of the terminal bosses is missing. Decorated with 7 unornamented ribs, between which are bars decorated with rope work. The complete terminal boss has its upper surface decorated with a central spike, & 14 small knobs surrounded by concentric circles. The lower plate of the terminal discs are decorated with 5 rows of circular knobs, each row being divided by rope work. The end of the gorget was passed into a slit at the back of the lower disc, where it was attached by a corrugated line burnished into a corresponding one in the collar. The wire stitchings now to be seen, do not appear to be ancient.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin, Plate VIII, 41, W 16.
pageContext.site: Ireland, Co Tipperary, near Nenagh, Ardcrony, found a spade's depth under the surface of a bog,
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
